title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Overall: 8.75/10

Story:

Spider-Man Remastered is an open world action-adventure game that delivers an engaging, character-driven story that expertly blends superhero action with personal drama. Set eight years into Peter Parker's career as Spider-Man, the narrative masterfully intertwines Peter’s personal life with his responsibilities as Spider-Man, while acknowledging the delicate balance between his life as a superhero and his personal life and relationships, delivering a story rich with emotional depth.
The game portrays Peter as an experienced superhero juggling his role as a protector of New York with his struggles in everyday life, creating a compelling dual narrative. His relationships with many recognizable key characters are deeply explored, adding layers of personal stakes to the story.
The game’s villain lineup is also very well-developed, offering intricate motivations that raise the tension as the plot unfolds. The pacing is near perfect, keeping you engaged through both thrilling action sequences and most quieter, character-driven moments. As events escalate, the narrative deftly balances themes of sacrifice, responsibility, and hope, creating a truly cinematic experience that resonates long after the credits roll. It’s an engaging narrative that feels both intimate and epic, setting a high standard for superhero storytelling in gaming.


Gameplay:

The core gameplay here excels in its fluidity and excitement. Swinging through New York City is a fun, fast, and incredibly smooth. The web-swinging mechanics make traversal feel exhilarating and seamless, with the layout of the buildings perfectly suited for navigation, giving a real sense of momentum and control. Combat is another very significant highlight, With Spider-Man’s agility and web abilities making every fight dynamic by offering a mix of acrobatic, gadget-based attacks and strategic thinking, making the whole system very reminiscent of the 'Batman: Arkham' series.
The game's skill tree and progression system provide meaningful upgrades that keep gameplay fresh, but the enemy types don't have the greatest variety and can feel slightly repetitive by the end of the game. Side activities, like collecting backpacks or taking on hideouts, are rewarding without being overwhelming, giving you plenty of opportunities to engage with the world at your own pace.
However, the gameplay isn’t without its drawbacks. The sections where you play as Miles Morales and Mary Jane feel painfully underwhelming. These stealth-focused segments, while short, disrupt the fast-paced momentum and excitement of being Spider-Man. They often feel like unnecessary filler, lacking the thrill that defines the rest of the game. While I can appreciate the variety in gameplay, I often found myself wondering, "Why is this not just a cutscene?" during these sequences.
Additionally, the random crimes scattered throughout the city become rather repetitive over time. While they offer some quick action between main missions, the lack of variety in objectives and enemy encounters makes them feel like a chore after a while, slightly diminishing the game's otherwise fantastic open-world experience.

World: 

The world design of Spider-Man Remastered is one of its standout features, offering a vibrant and detailed recreation of New York City. From the towering skyscrapers to the bustling streets below, the city feels alive, with NPCs, traffic, and subtle environmental details adding to the immersion. There is clearly thought put into every corner, making the open world feel like a playground tailored to Spider-Man’s abilities. Each district in New York is distinct, with landmarks like the Empire State Building, Avengers Tower, and more scattered across the map, encouraging exploration. The attention to detail in the small things like reflections in windows, environmental designs, etc. all create a living, breathing city that feels responsive.
In Spite of the impressive and beautifully crafted design though, the open-world structure can sometimes fall into the trap of open-world fatigue, where the repetitive activities diminishes the sense of discovery.

Visuals:

Having previously played 'Spider-Man (2018)' on PS4 years ago and being visually impressed back then, I was very pleasantly surprised at how Spider-Man Remastered showcases its very noticeably improved visuals that elevate the entire experience even further than before. The city of New York is stunning in detail, making it feel vibrant and alive. The attention to detail in the textures, lighting, and reflections—especially with ray tracing enabled—adds an extra layer of realism, allowing the city to shine both day and night. Whether swinging at high speed or exploring the ground level, the visual fidelity is impressive.
Character models are intricately designed, with highly expressive faces that capture subtle emotions, enhancing both gameplay and storytelling. The updated visuals in the remaster breathe new life into the characters, particularly during cutscenes, which are incredibly cinematic. These sequences feel like they’re straight out of a high-budget Marvel movie, with seamless transitions between gameplay and narrative moments, keeping you fully immersed.
On the technical side, this port offers plenty of options to adjust the performance to your needs. The higher frame rates and resolution make the already beautiful world even more impressive; However, on lower-end systems, some graphical features may need to be scaled back, which could slightly detract from the experience.

Music/Sound Design:

The music and sound design in Spider-Man Remastered play a crucial role in enhancing the game’s immersion and emotional impact; The soundtrack perfectly captures the heroic spirit of Spider-Man. The orchestral score dynamically shifts to match the action on screen—intensifying during combat or when you’re web-swinging through the city, and calming down during quieter, emotional moments. All the music evokes a sense of wonder and excitement, adding to the cinematic quality of the game.
In terms of sound design, every element feels finely tuned to heighten your experience. The iconic sound effect of Spider-Man's web-shooters, the satisfying impacts of punches during combat, and the ambient sounds of New York City all blend together seamlessly. Whether it’s the movement of pedestrians or the distant hum of traffic, the world feels alive thanks to the layered soundscape. Even small details, like the wind rushing past as you swing through the city, help you feel truly connected to the environment.
Voice acting is another standout, with performances that breathe life into the characters. Peter Parker’s quips during fights, the emotional weight of conversations, and even the in-game podcast chatter all feel natural and contribute to the storytelling.

TL;DR:

Spider-Man Remastered delivers a thrilling experience with a rich, emotional narrative that masterfully balances Peter Parker's personal struggles with his duties as a superhero. The gameplay shines with its fluid web-swinging and dynamic combat, though the stealth sections with Miles and Mary Jane, as well as repetitive random crimes, disrupt the otherwise exhilarating and fast-paced excitement. The open-world design beautifully recreates New York City, but it sometimes falls into common open-world tropes. Visually, the game excels, with stunning ray-traced reflections, detailed character models, and cinematic cutscenes that enhance the immersion, complemented by a soundtrack that perfectly contributes to the action and sound design that adds depth. While there are minor pacing issues, Spider-Man Remastered stands out as a visually stunning plus engaging superhero game and with all these things considered and being not just one of my favorite superhero games, but one of my favorite games PERIOD, it's obvious that I think this is a title EVERYONE needs their hands on!

ALSO SONY, BRING SPIDER-MAN 2 TO PC >:(

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Money well spent on a game in a long while. The story was amazing and brought me to tears at the end. 10/10 highly recommend it to anybody.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: a fun game with a very nice spiderman story the art design is truly enduring and the fight scenes are very enjoyable. freeroam wandering around new york city really made you feel like spiderman and the level of detail they added to the city

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Really takes you back to where just swinging around the town as spider man is fun.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Major ubisoft open world vibes. Do the same stuff over and over and over in 1834982 locations across the map.

Still had fun with it but the STEALTH MISSIONS ARE FUCKING TERRIBLE. GIVE US AN OPTION TO SKIP THESE. STOP PUTTING STEALTH MISSIONS IN SPIDER MAN GAMES

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered may not be as well-rounded an experience as Rocksteady's Arkham series. But when you're swinging through Time Square in glorious sunshine as New York's citizenry gazes at you from below, well, it's a superhero high that even the Caped Crusader would struggle to beat.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
In principle, the game is good, BUT:
If you are a fan of Spider-Man, then you will 100% like the game, if not, then the game has some disadvantages. Firstly, the game has very rebatative activities in the open world, in other words, a lot of single marks on the map (at first it's cool, but there are too many of them, and by the end it gets really boring). Secondly, the plot is a typical superhero plot (only morons won't be irritated by its stupidity). And the last significant disadvantage is that the dynamic gameplay for Spider-Man is diluted with dull quests for Mary Jane and Miles Morales.
Of course, the game has many advantages, because of which I recommend this game: very pleasant combat (dynamic, beautiful, exciting), although by the last chapter it got boring. Another huge advantage is the open world, in the sense that it is very beautiful. Overall, the game is really interesting to play, everything is beautiful and interesting, with the exception of a few of the above-described downsides.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I love the game so intresting a fun to play it never gets old and it only get better as the game goes on

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: great game, i played it before owning it on PC so i already knew i liked it and at $20 i couldn't say no, its by far better on PC.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: insane graphics insane story insane combat good length. def worth buying, it also has mod support

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: хорошая игра, рекомендую любителям паучка, приятный геймплей от которого получаешь расслабленте

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Dope. Swinging around Manhattan is much fun! Superb graphics. For an average gamer even the bossfights seem nice :)

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
10/10 Graphics
10/10 Story
10/10 Gameplay
10/10 Mechanics
10/10 Enjoyment
10/10 characters

Overall: 10/10, Very sigma game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I really enjoyed playing as Spider-Man. I cannot overstate enough how much fun it is to just swing around the city and save people. The story was quite good and integrated Spider-Man villains in a engaging way. I liked that you got to fight some big villains and the classic "hey give me your money" muggers. The DLC was integrated in this remastered PC version of the game and was also quite enjoyable as I do love Black Cat (who doesn't???). I thought that swinging around the map and completing all of the map markers, objectives, etc was engaging and didn't feel too repetitive OUTSIDE OF the stupid Screwball challenges. I hated those so much more than I can properly express. They were one of the last achievements I got because I just kept putting them off. You feel like Spider-Man while you're playing this, quips and all, albeit with maybe a bit more tech than I usually would expect out of him. You can unlock suits from many different iterations of Spider-Man and I loved swapping between them to try out their unique abilities. The game is also quite good looking and I found myself taking lots of pretty screenshots in different areas of the city or in combat. In total it took me just shy of 54 hours to 100% the game. I fully recommend this game at full price or on sale as I think it's got more than enough content to be worth it.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: First time i've played this one. I know it came out a few years ago on playstation but i havent played a spidermasn game since the old ones in the early 2000s. this is amazing. listening to post malone and swinging really transports you to a new mood. amazing.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Fantastic game.

The highlight is truly the traversal system, the way Spiderman moves is simply amazing.
Highly addictive, I rarely used the fast forward because it was so enticing to travel through the city.

The combat and mission are also diverse enough not to become stale and repetitive over time, at first I wasn't too fond of the Gadgets but they are very interesting and amusing to use.

Storywise also good, some very well delivered lines and situations give the required gravitas to each villain fight.

Voice acting is very good across all characters. Villains in particular.

The only thing I did not like was when I have to do some missions with MJ or Miles but fortunately they are scarce, not long and pretty simple.
It's just a downgrade from playing the amazing Spiderman and the story bits it brings are not very amusing.

The only one that is actually interesting is a latter mission with MJ where we must coordinate with Spiderman to round up some bad guys, but aside from that particular mission we are always alone with that side caracter doing basic human stuff and it's kind of meh.
But like I said, they are only 4 or 5 missions like this, in a world of Spiderman ones.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: After completing Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered, finishing 100% of the game, and getting all the steam achievements, it's getting a LARGE 5 star rating from me. The main story was well written and all the cut-scenes, side quests, villians, and DLCs were worth the money. The fighting is exactly how I would picture it would look if Spider-Man was real and BIG PLUS to having the Tobey Maguire suit available to be played as cause hes the best, no contest.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Web slinging around Manhattan is pretty fun, but the combat and other aspects of the game get repetitive. Worth getting on sale.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This is like, the ONE triple A that matters. Holy fuck it matters so much. What a game. That last scene with Doc made me cry. I plan to write a more extense review at some point but like. It's good. That's all you need to know.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: What's not to like? Web slinging about the city. Fighting bad guys and trying to get better upgrades for the suit and gadgets. Just so much fun to mess around.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I love it, the game runs great with my RTX 4060, the story is amazing, one of the best video games of spider man.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: great game very entertaining great story great mechanics

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: side missions are fun ngl but who tf decided to lock the ultimate difficulty to second playthrough i need to play the game again for one achievment

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Spider-Man Remastered really takes an already amazing game and just makes it so much better. Visual improvements in this are stunning, and swinging through New York feels smoother than ever. Even the faster load times and updated character models give it a different feel, but it still retains all the fun of the original. It still retains a story that is just as gripping, and the combat is super fluid, satisfying. Honestly, a replay or jumping in for the first time, it is one of the best superhero games out there.

Just incredible visual improvements, smoother mechanics, and faster load times take an already great game in Spider-Man Remastered and elevate the experience to a whole new level. The story remains compelling and emotionally engaging, while the combat and traversal mechanics continue to shine, offering a fluid and dynamic gameplay experience. However, the open world can feel a bit repetitive at times, and some stealth and puzzle sections may slow down the pace. For those who haven't played the original, the remastered version is a must-play, delivering one of the best superhero games available. If you already own the original, it comes down to how much you value the enhanced graphics and next-gen performance. If you're eager for the best possible version of the game, it's worth the investment. However, if you're satisfied with the original, the remaster might not offer enough to warrant a second purchase.

Spider-Man Remastered doesn't just look great—it tells a fantastic story too. It goes really in-depth into Peter Parker's life, with the juggling of responsibilities as both a superhuman and an everyday man. You get to see him juggle his relationships, face certain choices of action, and go up against iconic villains such as Doctor Octopus, Rhino, and the Vulture. The way the game tackles storytelling is just so legitimate and emotional; Peter's struggles have made him super relatable. Plus, its character development is pretty spot on, mainly the building up of his relationship with characters like MJ and Aunt May. The story mixed with the amazing gameplay really makes it an immersive experience. For sure, the mechanics within Spider-Man Remastered make it really great.

Swinging through New York is slick, instinctive practice that manages to capture a very real sense of freedom as you sweep between skyscrapers. The combat flows well, with the correct dose of web-slinging, acrobatics, and gadgets that will make combat with enemies quite varied and entertaining. There is a feel that you can pull off awesome combos and dodge attacks with Spidey agility deftly, using the environment against foes. The stealth aspect in the game is equally well-implemented, where the player can sneak around and silently take out enemies where required. Whether you’re in a high-speed chase or taking on a group of thugs, the controls are responsive, making the action feel satisfying every time. While Spider-Man Remastered is an amazing game, it does have a few minor flaws. It's wonderfully designed, but sometimes the open world feels a little same-ish.

Side missions and random street crimes tend to be very similar, and oftentimes will feel somewhat like filler after a while. A few of these puzzle and stealth sections-especially ones where you switch to playing as MJ or Miles-can suck the air out of what would otherwise be pulsating with high-energy action. Whether or not the Spider-Man Remastered version is worth purchasing really depends on how much you value the visual upgrades and next-generation performance improvements if you already own the original Spider-Man game. The remastered version looks absolutely beautiful, and with quicker loading and an altogether smoother experience, it really gives the game polish. Still, the underlying story and gameplay remain the same. If you’re a huge fan of the game and want to see it in its best possible form, the remaster is worth the investment. But if you’re content with the original and aren’t too concerned about the graphical improvements, it might not be a must-buy.

In conclusion, Spider-Man Remastered elevates an already fantastic game with stunning visual improvements, smoother mechanics, and faster load times, making the experience even more enjoyable. The story remains compelling and emotionally engaging, while the combat and traversal mechanics continue to shine, offering a fluid and dynamic gameplay experience. However, the open world can feel a bit repetitive at times, and some stealth and puzzle sections may slow down the pace.

For those who haven't played the original, the remastered version is a must-play, delivering one of the best superhero games available. If you already own the original, it comes down to how much you value the enhanced graphics and next-gen performance. If you're eager for the best possible version of the game, it's worth the investment. However, if you're satisfied with the original, the remaster might not offer enough to warrant a second purchase.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Amazing!! Love the graphics and the game play. I've been wanting this since it came out on play station. I even bought a gaming computer to play this. I've also already bought the Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales because I knew I would love this game. I highly recommend buying this.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Great port over to the pc! Love the story and the mechanics. Truly an amazing and beautiful game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: really good experience , I finished the game 100% and unlocked all the achievements, worth every penny  :D

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I forgot how wonderful this game was. I laughed, I cried, I unlocked the old-timey comic book suit at the last minute. I'll do the dlc eventually, but I need to take a little break, the last hour or two were really intense. Pizza Time out of 10, absolute recommend!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Second time 100% the game! Fully recommend if you love a great story that is fresh and well written.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
If you've never played this game before I highly recommend giving it a shot. The story is pretty good! Easy to digest and appreciate. The game flows well, the combat is smooth and engaging. and the characters are easy to invest in. You can unlock all kinds of spider suits that are new to the franchise and legacy outfits from the comics and television adaptations. This game has some of the best fan service you can ask for as a marvel fan. 

Only one real gripe I have with this game is the Mary Jane and Miles missions. They aren't bad by any stretch just boring compared to the normal gameplay. One minute you're zipping across sky scrapers and the next you're forced into a stealth section as a normie. There are mods on Nexus that allow you to skip these missions that are fairly easy to install with a mod manager. 

In summation, if you're a fan of Spider-Man or just Marvel in general, you will probably enjoy this game a lot. If you're the person that doesn't care for Marvel but you do enjoy stealth, movement mechanics and beat em up style games you will also probably enjoy this.... If you are J. Jonah Jameson you will HATE this game

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
With great power, comes great responsibillty. (c) Uncle Ben 
The game is wonderful. Indeed Insomniac did their best to learn the lore of the Marvel Universe, so much references, so much fun, and the main story is wonderful yet sad, but it's really worth to play and get 100% achievement. 
9/10 a solid and good product and game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This is a fantastic game, with one of the best traversal physics in any video game i've played. It also has an incredible story to dive into, as well.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
[h1] I love this game and I recommend playing it before the others. [/h1]


[h3] Story / DLC: [/h3]
The story is really good and progresses nicely, it finishes at around 60% of the game.
Took me a while to complete both on [b] New Game [/b] & [b] New Game+. [/b]
My favourite out of the 3 DLC's was [b] Silver Lining. [/b]
In my opinion, [b] The Heist [/b] & [b] Turf Wars [/b] were a bit boring and felt just like
a lot of enemy bases over and over again.

[h3] Collectables: [/h3]
There are 51 suits to collect in this game and most of are really cool, a lot of them from the different movies.
I prefer the amount of gadgets in this game (8) to [b] Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales. [/b] (4)
There are a lot of miscellaneous items to collect from the backpacks too.


[h3] Swinging: [/h3]
One of my favourite parts of this game is the swinging.
It's very fun when you're going fast, especially with all the skill upgrades.
However, the tricks are very basic compared to [b] Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales. [/b]


[h3] Combat: [/h3]
The combat is really satisfying. in my opinion, more than [b] Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales. [/b]
However, I prefer the use of [b] Venom Power [/b] in that game and the smoother animations too.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: One of the best in the PS4's line up. There was a lot of controversy with Peter's face change, but IMO its not a big deal. A great telling of a Peter Parker story. Yes, some story hits are obvious, and 100% can be tedious. But just the feeling of swinging around NY living Parker's life. Amazing. Def worth a play

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Great story, fun gameplay with lots of customization to fit whatever playstyle for spidey

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Very fun but small story i have completed pretty much the whole game just got like 2 side story's to complete so like 90% finish the game in like 20 hours.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Great game, I do want to make note it sadly crashes constantly with no reason why. I disabled raytracing since during raining it causes more crashes. So I guess the outsourced dev team that worked on this port simply did not bother fixing the problem. It sadly make me stop playing the dlcs since that is where most of the crashes are happening. I think my recommend is to go safe with the console version since that would be better optimized against crashes. Outside of that overall main game story is ok but the gameplay is amazing.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Grind, grind and grind,... Responsibility... Oh wait Story is amazzzing 100/10. Love it!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I beat the game in around 10 hours and the story was great. 9/10. You should get it also for the 100% percent aspect.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Its an amazing game, it has an engaging story, good combat, and while the traversal is slower than the later games, it isn't slow enough for it to be an issue.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Every time i booted up the game, my inner child came out and i couldn't help but simply enjoy being in Spidey's shoes again. Last time i played anything Spider-Man related was PS2 games. It felt amazing. Truly a wonderful game

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Good game. Played on amazing level, not super hard, couple of annoying times i got ganged up on and kinda stun locked but thats it. no grinding unless you want all the suit witch lets be real you do and even then its really not that bad just kinda forces you to interact with the side content and really fill out that friendly neighborhood spiderman vibe which is cool. story is good nothing amazing but what you expect. it like watching a good marvel movie but you get to do shit. does TLDR: no surprises very good. its what what it says on the box but boy is it a good box

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Such a good game! I’m halfway through it and I love it. The movement is amazing, and the combat offers multiple ways to fight, whether it’s being stealthy, just punching the heck out of the bad guys, or webbing them up with the tons of different gadgets. The story is pretty good, too, and I’m excited to see where it ends up. I’m going to buy Miles Morales once I finish this, and I’m excited for the second one to come out on PC!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: this game is awesome, has great story and amazing side missions. The DlCs are the bomb and overall the best game of all time for spiderman games

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
What I like was that you really feel the free spirit of how spider-man should be played and design on a game.
To see the flow of the fighting style being able to change up is epic. The open design of how New York was designed.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This game is incredible, sticking (no pun intended) to the classic spidey game-play. 10/10 Great Story and Even Better origin stories.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Solid game. Top quality. No crash.  great graphics. Only compliant is they might worked on NPC AI. I mean pedestrians walking on streets. Thats only minor. 
Recommended.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Very good story, almost great (though the Sabre act feels like padding and fighting their troops is annoying), fantastic game feel and the best web swinging since Spider-Man 2 on the PS2.  Feels like a nice evolution of Arkham's Freeflow combat system while also carving out its own identity.

Like the Arkham series though it really makes you want to drop the cliche "really makes you feel like Spider-Man".  Kinda does though.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I honestly love this game and it's really fun but it's really damn annoying trying to get INTO the game. Every single time I try to play it has an error and makes me report some kind of "issue" that has occurred and makes me wait for hours and even days. It's changed my view on even thinking of trying to play the game anymore and it's too late to refund now so bye bye $60.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This is the best written and performed Spiderman story there has been this millenium.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Beautiful game.  Very relaxing swinging through the city and plenty of bad guys to beat up.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This is a great game, loved it from the beginning. It's so immersive, and the swinging is fun.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: As good as the Playstation version but with the advantages of PC such as widescreen support and better performance...not that the PS version looks bad or anything. Moving around the city is fun and the fights are fun. I really dislike the forced stealth missions...special any MJ mission...it just slow downs the game to much for something that is not the forte of this game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: The main storyline is a bit short and there are a lot of collectibles but its fun to collect them when you can swing around and shi

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Being a hardcore spider man fan i can assure you this game will be worth of every penny u spend. This is my second playthrough  while writing this review. Your friendly neighbourhood signing off 🕷️

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
quippy, funny, and charming, our classic beloved spiderman swings into our hearts.
simlpy a great game. every websling feels visceral like you are really swinging through the air. you can feel every punch and kick to criminals.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Finished this twice on PS4, playing it now with mods for swinging; it's just a really fucking good game. 

Give us Bloodborne!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: its a great game sofar looking to 100% ik its 2024 and 3 games have been brought out but stil DAMNNN

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Marval fans You guys get it playing spider man games has been since 2005 i think and this game is the best version i have play

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Chill fun game. Looks great. Performs just fine. Basically get to do cool spiderman shit, whats not to like?

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
This Game was a fun and a very enjoyable playable experience. The story had good pace throughout the game {got better further on} 
Swinging through the city is just very fun and just never boring.
Unlocking different gadgets, suits and extra powers just betters the experience
The extra Free DLC's make the game just MAKE the game Better!
Only few downsides are, not that cheap and movement is slighly annyoing at times.
The game does very good to lead on the next game {miles morales} 
8/10

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: It has a good story line and keeps you entertained even just swinging around the city is fun I highly recommend it!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: the game was great all around ,a few bugs but they fixed pretty quick.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: played the story 10+ times on my ps4 before buying for pc cuz of mods, so that can tell smth abt  the game absolutely incredible story, with an even better gameplay. a must play if ur a spider-man fan :D now wishing for msm2 for pc

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: overall, really good game with great game play and a great story.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Imagine everything that was good about Spider-Man 2 for the Playstation 2 and add twenty years of advancements to it. There's no other video game that makes you feel like Spider-Man like this one. The only thing I didn't like were the Mary Jane stealth missions and the difficult swinging challenges, but those are optional.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: The graphics, the music, the characters- perfect

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Marvel's Spider-Man never fails to make me have fun and i never get tired of it
and i've got like 7 different saves in the ps4 that's all 100%

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I was a little skeptical at first on how the game would translate to PC controls with it being originally made with a controller in mind. While it is a bit of a learning curve it was pretty easy to get used to the controls. The game itself is still a damn good game with better graphics! Highly recommend this game for any fans of Spider-man.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: The open world is beautiful. The swinging mechanics are so fun. The combat is addictive. The story is the best I've seen in a game for a while. I could think of no reason not to recommend it.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Best game played for a while.  Definitely recommended for all Spider-Man fans. Excellent story, graphic and game play. So smooth on ROG Ally amazing game on handheld platform.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I've play all the Spider-Man games and I have to say in my humble opinion this ones the best. Whether its the gadgets or the suits I like this game the most. :)

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: fab game and alot to do it keeps you going,the gameplay and graphics are amazing wow a turn around

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Just as fun when I first played it on the PS4, didn't finish it there since it was my cousin's PS4. But now I can, thanks for bringing this gem of a game on PC Sony!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Great game with great swinging and combat mechanics

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Truly stellar. Crisp game play with a strong story, cemented by how much of a joy it is to traverse the map. Swinging and leaping is a real treat.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: On my third play-trough and I absolutely love the combat, the story and ofcourse the swinging

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Avaliação geral

1. Qualidade gráfica:
🔲 Veio de outra dimensão, você se confunde com a realidade (1,00 pontos)
✅ Uma obra de arte, cada frame foi pintado por Leonardo da Vinci (0,75 pontos)
🔲 Nada de surpreendente, está dentro do esperado para este jogo (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Parece com os gráficos dos jogos do Atari (0,25 pontos)
🔲 É todo pixelado, parece estar com a resolução em 144p (0,00 pontos)

2. Requisitos de sistema:
🔲 Qualquer coisa que conduza energia (1,00 pontos)
🔲 Um computador batata mas não tão batata assim (0,75 pontos)
✅ Um computador já considerado gamer (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Pergunte à N.A.S.A. se ela tem um computador a disposição (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Esqueça, a tecnologia atual não dá conta deste jogo (0,00 pontos)

3. Dificuldade e jogabilidade:
🔲 Você precisa ter reflexos instantâneos e 4 mãos (1,00 pontos)
🔲 Necessita de um uso significativo do cérebro (0,75 pontos)
✅ Depende da dificuldade ou modalidade que você escolher (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Seu cachorro consegue jogar tranquilamente (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Da para jogar com uma batata no lugar do controle (0,00 pontos)

4. Qualidade da história:
✅ Dava para fazer um livro no nível do Harry Potter (1,0 pontos)
🔲 William Shakespeare escreveu junto com Machado de Assis (0,75 pontos)
🔲 Uma história digna de se prestar atenção (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Era melhor ter ido ver o filme do Pelé (0,25 pontos)
🔲 História? Nunca nem vi, que dia foi isso? (0,00 pontos)

5. Qualidade de áudio e trilha sonora:
🔲 Toque o tema em seu casamento (1,00 pontos)
✅ Mozart compôs junto com Beethoven (0,75 pontos)
🔲 Nada de especial, dá para escutar tranquilamente (0,50 pontos)
🔲 É melhor jogar no mudo (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Está no nível do funk brasileiro (0,00 pontos)

6. Público-alvo:
✅ Qualquer ser humano que tenha um bom gosto (1,00 pontos)
🔲 Adultos e adolescentes (0,75 pontos)
🔲 Espermatozoides e crianças (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Extraterrestres e seres sobrenaturais (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Pessoas que conhecem a morte (0,00 pontos)

7. Custo-benefício:
🔲 É de graça, cavalo dado não se olha os dentes (1,00 pontos)
✅ Vale cada centavo, compre imediatamente sem arrependimentos (0,75 pontos)
🔲 Espere por uma promoção (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Compre se você quiser gastar o seu dinheiro em algo aleatório (0,25 pontos)
🔲 É mais fácil você apenas queimar o seu dinheiro (0,00 pontos)

8. Diversão e entretenimento:
🔲 As melhores horas da sua vida (1,00 pontos)
✅ Você nunca esquecerá o quanto este jogo te divertiu (0,75 pontos)
🔲 É repetitivo mas vai te entreter (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Difícil de se gostar (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Prefiro ver uma poça d’água secar (0,00 pontos)

9. Fator replay:
🔲 Provavelmente você jogará pelo resto da sua vida (1,00 pontos)
🔲 Se você jogar com amigos poderá aproveitar um pouco mais (0,75 pontos)
✅ Vale a pena apenas pelas conquistas (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Se esperar alguns meses ou anos talvez você jogue novamente (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Experiência de uma vez só, depois o jogo se torna um enfeite (0,00 pontos)

10. Falhas:
🔲 É simplesmente impecável, este jogo saiu perfeito do forno (1,00 pontos)
✅ Existem algumas, mas são legais e não atrapalham a gameplay (0,75 pontos)
🔲 Existem muitas, mas dá para jogar se você for paciente (0,50 pontos)
🔲 Parece até uma lâmpada acesa cheia de insetos (0,25 pontos)
🔲 Tem falha por todo lado, igual tiro em favela no Rio de Janeiro (0,00 pontos)

Pontuação final: 7.25 de 10,00

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
The base game, a masterpiece. The heist dlc, brilliant.

Also. Black Cat, I can fix her.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Honestly just one of the most fun I've had playing a video game in a long time, the story is great, the combat is great, the movement and map traversal is bloody superb.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: actually so fun. great spiderman game great story recommend both of the games on steam and when the third one comes out i would recommend it as well

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: It's nice to relive the experience of swinging through New York City on PC. My go-to chill game right now.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Love the game, but once you play the new Marvel's Spider-Man game, this one feels a little boring, no hate tho, still an amazing game!

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This is a GREAT super hero game.  I am at 6hrs as of writing this and I'm loving every minute.  Graphics are very good, the voice acting is superb, and the story is engrossing.  Gameplay is tight, fun, and varied.  Nothing really beats just swinging around NYC at the end of the day.  It's so smooth and you can feel the weight and the speed.  It's not perfect as there are some little nuisances here and there, but it's as close to perfect as it gets.  9/10  You really ARE Spidey in this.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I've only played this game (at this time) for about an hour, but I can confidently say that I will be returning to play this game. The gameplay is just unmatched. The only problem of this game is that you require a decent pc to run this game. Other than that, the mechanics are very well made. Swinging around at night while listening to music is another kind of vibe that can only be achieved by playing this masterpiece.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
So far, the game plays just like a modern remake to the originals back on PS1-2 which is fantastic.

Not a bunch of extra bloat and of course all DLC is included in this version.

10/10

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Great game for any Spider-Man fan, only down side is maybe too many collectibles. They give you something to do in the world which is nice (swinging around the city is easily the highlight of this game). Gameplay gets very repetitive after a while, I still haven't played Miles Morales or Spider-Man 2 but it'll probably have to be a long break after beating this game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: Very fun game let's you explore NYC like spider-man makes you feel like spider-man a little bit and even on top of that the web swinging feels great the story is good and the gadgets are great in this game besides that the mj and miles sneaking parts kinda stink the rest of the game was a blast and made me feel like i was on a spider-man adventure

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
This game was unbelievably great.

The movement, the fighting, the movement, the perfect difficulty, the movement, the enemies all having character and are not just being plain evil, the movement, the stories were aresome, and also, almost forgot to mention this, the movement.

10/10. What a fucking game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: One of the best games I played on the steam deck really shows the steam decks capability's. I highly recommend whoever is getting a steam deck or has a steam deck to get this game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered is an insanely great open-world superhero game. I never expected a superhero game to be this fun. The stunning visuals and insane graphics, combined with smooth controls and a great storyline, make it a complete package. Insomniac Games has truly outdone themselves with this game.

I loved every moment of it, including all the DLCs. The skill tree, gadgets, and different suits with unique powers provide a fresh look and new ways to play every time. It’s so easy to recommend this game to anyone. Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered is a must-play for any gaming enthusiast. I'm so excited for the sequel to drop on PC.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: good game but the story is too slow over all good game its emotinol and its good

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: This game is absolutely amazing, its extremely well optimized, great graphics, i dont get tired at looking the beautiful different suits, one of the best stories i've seen in videogames. If you like Spider-Man buy this game. If you liked Spider-Man just a little bit as a kid, like me, buy this game. Even if you don't care much about Spider-Man but like a well-written, solid game, buy this game.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: As you'd expect from Spider-Man content, it's emotional, action-packed, and pretty fun

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review:
pizza time,
this and batman arkham series are the best superhero games of all time,
its great to even just load it up and swing around NYC for hours without doing any story missions

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: I've completed this game 4 times on my steam deck,best spiderman game ever.The swinging mechanic is amazing and fluid,along with the 'arkham' style combat. Amazing story. 10/10. Probably will complete for the 5th time.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered
review: One of the best mechanics in a game really well optimised and the story is really good would recommend
